Posts.Content: On Jan 22, 2015 3:40 PM boc0913 wrote: Sorry to hear about your reaction too.  With so many responding, its seem the drug manufacture would have more info on this.  What an either or situation this is?  So many challenges and then making the decision on whether to take something with so many side effects for such a long time. Thank you all for your input.  It really helps, as I do have a decision to make.  I truly hope they can find a resolution. I've suddenly had severe allergic reaction to antibiotics.  It started when I had an extreme case of cellulitis in my breast in Oct, which ultimately led to my diagnosis.  After mastectomy and reconstruction, they tried a different med, and about a week later another reaction.  So, I can sympathize with the skin rashes and itches.  I hope they can find a compromise for you.  Maybe a different, similar drug.  Does anyone have sore mouth from taking arimidex?
Posts.Title: Arimidix (anastrozole) skin side effects?
